授業方法:
This course will be conducted face-to-face.
Depending on the evolving situation, course format may include the following:
- Individual, pair, and group discussion based on topics that relate to content
- Sharing of information, including weekly homework assignments, on Google Classroom- Presentation and homework assignments
- All components conducted in English
- As a level 3 course, all English tasks expected to be completed at an advanced level

第1回:
**The schedule below is an example of what the course will look like. Specific contents will not be decided upon until after a needs analysis is done (during first class) to determine the interests, backgrounds, and needs of enrolled students**

Week 1: Class overview, introductions, ice breakers
第2回: Week 2: What is culture and intercultural communication? Discuss first 280-word journal
第3回: Week 3: A critical comparison of intercultural competence and cultural intelligence (CQ); discuss second 280-word journal
第4回: Week 4: What composes a person's identity? A cross-cultural perspective. Discuss third 280-word journal
第5回: Week 5: Mixed ethnicities and heritages - examining contemporary issues in both Japan and Canada; discuss fourth 280-word journal
第6回: Week 6: Using different forms of mass-media to identify and discuss prejudice, discrimination, and racism; discuss fifth 280-word journal
第7回: Week 7: A critical look at models of cultural dimensions - Hofstede and Trompenaars & Hampden-Turner; discuss sixth 280-word journal
第8回: Week 8: Exploring Paris syndrome and comparable cross-cultural experiences; discuss seventh 280-word journal
第9回: Week 9: Examining different varieties of English - World Englishes in verbal and nonverbal 	forms; discuss eighth 280-word journal
第10回: Week 10: Perceptions of world regions (e.g. Scandinavia) and differences between regional neighbors; discuss ninth 280-word journal
第11回: Week 11: Adapting to new environments and how Japan is influenced by contemporary culture; discuss final 280-word journal
トピック.授業外学習2: Each class will involve information and topics that will need to be applied to a final presentation. It is the students’ responsibility to make notes during each class so they can successfully accomplish this. Each class, students will need to submit a 280-word journal based on discussion questions related to the topic. You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments. Students will be expected to perform tasks at an advanced level.
